Name: Tannhäuser: Asteros
Description:
Fantasy Flight Games is excited to announce the upcoming release of Asteros, a single figure expansion for Tannhäuser! Hidden deep within the Labyrinth for centuries, the minotaur Asteros yearns to wreck havoc on the world above. He is an unnatural beast that cannot be reasoned with. Do you dare unchain him?

Asteros comes packaged with a detailed pre-painted figure of the legendary minotaur, equipped with rules, tokens, and a unique scenario. With no prior allegiances, Asteros can be used with any faction. Since Asteros is an Epic Hero, he is fielded with a smaller force than normal, replacing a hero and a trooper on account of his legendary power and sheer size

Name: Snap It Up! Spelling
Description:
From the back of the box: A fast-paced card game that builds spelling and reading skills.  Pick and pass cards as fast as you can to spell three and four letter words. The first player to spell three words wins!

From the instructions: Players start with 3 consonant cards in their hands and stack the rest of their consonant cards face down.  Vowel cards are placed face up in the center of the table.  All players simultaneously try to make a 3 or 4-letter word using their consonant cards and the vowel card in the center.  Players take the vowel card and place the word on the table, flipping over a new vowel card and drawing new consonant cards.  Spelling three words correctly wins the game.

Name: Warhammer: Invasion – Bleeding Sun
Description:
From the Publisher's Site:
Bleeding Sun is the sixth Battle Pack installment of The Enemy Cycle, the linked expansion series for Warhammer: Invasion, a card game of intense warfare, clever kingdom management, and epic questing. In this exciting conclusion to The Enemy Cycle, all six factions gain valuable new powers... but who will come out on top?

Blessing of Myrmidia brings strength to the Knights of the Empire, while the vile Beast of Rot feeds on the power of Nurgle. Meanwhile, the Orcs tame a Giant Spider and the High Elves harness the power of the Moon Staff of Lileath!

This 60 card pack contains 20 different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Warhammer: Invasion metagame.
Families: Game: Warhammer Invasion – Living Card Game

Name: Jeffing
Description:
Jeffing is a traditional gambling game played by printers, using movable type as dice. In particular, the em quad (a piece of type without a letter, used to introduce a space of em width) was used as it approximated a cube and had a nick in one face (to indicate the front of the piece of type). 
Players cast five or seven em quads on a flat surface and count the number of nicks showing on the tops of the quads. All players agree on a stake. Players than cast the em quads the same number of times and the highest scoring player wins the stake. The remaining players then cast the quads again and the lowest scoring player has to pay the highest scoring player the stake.

This description is based on a description from the early 19th century, an excerpt of which can be read here: http://www.poormojo.org/pmjadaily/archives/026778.php

Name: Double Cross
Description:
Card game with three separate rulebooks: Conquest, Rings, and Double Cross.  52 card deck in 4 suits but with substitutions for queens,  8, 9, 10. these substitutions are scoring and penalty cards.
Conquest:  This is a bridge like bidding and trick taking game but differs in that you do not bid for tricks but for number of scoring cards which must be obtained by taking tricks. 
Rings:  A children's matching game with a common "hand" in the middle which players hands are matched up with and scored with the scoring cards.
Double Cross: Object is to get rid of all the cards in your hand first. This is done by creating a sequenced pile in the middle of the table, (similar to Kings in the Corner). Score cards are played face up in front of you.

Name: Monopoly: Dinosaur Edition
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Step back in time with this special Dinosaur Edition of the MONOPOLY game. Learn fun facts about popular dinosaurs as you buy, sell and trade the Spinosaurus, Velociraptor, Stegosaurus and more. Game includes beautiful illustrations of dinosaur species and six collectible fossil tokens depicting a dinosaur egg, footprint, skeleton, T-Rex skull, Triceratops skull and claw. A prehistoric relic for dinosaur enthusiasts of all ages.

Name: Bach
Description:
From the game:  Johann Sebastian Bach was a composer who lived in the 18th century.  He is known as one of the greatest composers of classical music.  Bach is also an exciting game of chance and skill that introduces some basic elements of music theory without detracting from the playability of the game.  Bach is a thoughtful and cahallenging game for anyone from the age of 10 to adult, regardless of any previous knowledge of music theory.

Each player takes turns drawing cards and moving notes to form scales.  The first player to form the required scales wins the game.

The first game may take about 1 1/2 hours.  Once you know how to play, each game will average about an hour.

Game components are:

1 board
26 plastic chips with green and blue stickers on opposite sides.
2 information cards
23 key cards
65 interval cards
rulebook

The board is placed between opponents so that each is facing one of the note rows corresponding to the color on their chips.  All notes are place on the note rows so that each note matches the letters and symbols in each square.

The cards are separated into two decks of interval and key cards and placed face down beside the board.  The green player draws the top key card.  It tells you the scales that you have to form to win the game, and it must stay hidden until the end of the game.  The blue player does the same.  The rest of the key cards are put away.

The green player always goes first.  He/she draws an interval card, showing it to their opponent.  The card tells how many squares you can move one "note" as well as the direction that can be moved.

Game play continues until one of the players has formed their scales, and shouts "I win" or something similar.  If this is shouted and the player has not formed their correct scales, play continues and that player loses a turn.  The game is over when one player has completed the scales indicated on their interval card.

Name: KISS DVD Board Game
Description:
Back of the Box:

BECOME THE LEADER OF THE KISS ARMY!

Follow KISS on tour and travel the world collecting merchandise, albums and programs.  You’ll even start your own KISS tribute band!  Do you have what it takes to become the leader of the KISS® Army?!

Players travel to the different zones on the game board (each zone represents one particular aspect of being a KISS Army member). Collect KISS cards by landing on the "DEMON", "STARCHILD", "CATMAN" and "SPACEMAN" spaces. Once you have collected the required KISS cards for a zone, you redeem them for a KISS Army card. Once you collect all 4 KISS Army cards (1 in each zone) you have become the leader of the KISS Army and win the game!

Name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Order of the Silver Twilight
Description:
The Order of the Silver Twilight features 3 copies each of 55 never-before-seen cards - 40 for Order of the Silver Twilight, 2 for each of the existing factions, and 1 neutral card - that will permanently change the environment of the Call of Cthulhu metagame. Moreover, from this expansion forward the Order of the Silver Twilight will be a full faction within the game and all future expansions of the Call of Cthulhu card game will feature cards from the Order of the Silver Twilight alongside the other factions.

The Order of the Silver Twilight is made up of a secret cabal of leading politicians, charismatic socialites, persuasive civic leaders, and successful businessmen who must pass through successive ranks of occult initiation and ritual to emerge into the inner sanctum of the Order, there to pursue their quest for ultimate earthly - and unearthly - power. To represent the Order's magical mastery in the game, The Order of the Silver Twilight introduces an assortment of versatile and challenging cards whose game mechanics mesh well with a variety of decks and play styles.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Call of Cthulhu – The Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Formula D: Circuits 3 – Singapore & The Docks
Description:
Expansion Tracks for Formula D

From the publisher:

1. Singapore -- this track is a one-of-a-kind night-time street race, with a mix of fast turns and slow chicanes that will test your nerve and push your skills to the limit!

2. The Docks -- this fantasy track has 3 routes around which one may race.  Each route has its own dangers (this track was the winner of the ASM's track design contest).

From the Publisher:

Are you a fan of Formula D? One of the most renown racing games is about to improve again with the addition of two new circuits in the third extension.

Discover the urban circuit of Singapore by night. It is characterized by tight turns and a new aspect of racing: illumination. A challenge which requires technical virtuosity and maximum adaptability!

The aficionados of street racing will be able to discover a high-risk track on an industrial dock with first light of dawn. A subtle mixture of improvised obstacles and roads for a mortal playing field!

Name: ABeeC Match Game
Description:
From Game Instructions:
A BEE C Match Game is a fast-paced letter matching game for all ages.  You don't have to know how to spell to play and you don't have to be a spelling bee champ to win. Simply match letter to letter and collect 7 cards to win.

Gameplay: On your turn, roll a handful of dice and match any dice you can to letters on the three playable cards.  Put the last letter on a card and you win the card for a point and the dice for more to roll!

Name: Soletrando
Description:
Soletrando is a spelling game based on the Soletrando TV Show. It can be played both as a videogame or as a boardgame. The goal of the game is to correctly spell more words than other players.

Each match has 5 rounds. The 1st, 2nd, 4th and 5th rounds are played like this: in your turn, the player on your left chooses a card based on your age and level (1 or 2). You must correctly spell the word, including hyphens. At any time you can ask for a tip. The player on your left must read the definition of the word. If you don´t make any mistakes, put a token in the column for the current round. The only difference in the 3rd round, is that a dice must be played to determine the level of the word for spelling.

Name: Swing States
Description:
Swing states is the game of political domination!  Players take turns rolling for votes and then players use those votes to choose which state to influence.

On a Player's Turn:
The current player rolls 4  6-sided dice.  If a die has your parties matching color on it it is counted as one vote for your party. 
(colors are included in the published version, 
otherwise  1-2-3 = Elephants 4-5-6 = Donkies.  With your party's votes, you may purchase state/s influence.

States are influenced by Votes.  Your own 
parties color costs 1 vote, while your opponents color and the independent party's color (Green) cost 2 votes to influence. You may influence as many states as you can with your votes.

If a state is already occupied you may influence it by paying double the cost it would normally cost you.  The only states that don't apply to these rules are the Swing States (Orange Colored states)

Name: Flames of War: Blitzkrieg – The German Invasion of Poland and France 1939-1940
Description:
From publisher:
"At 4.45 on the morning of September 1, 1939 the soldiers of the German army launched their Blitzkrieg into Poland. World War II had begun."

User Summary:
This book allows the players to field armies for the Early War period (1939-41), from Poland, Germany, Britain (BEF - British Expedionary Force) and France.

Name: Future Battlefield
Description: Future Battlefield is is a fast 2-4 player strategic board game. Players prove one of the two modern army and use action points, which have on the battlefield during its turn. In turn, players can move units, attack, hide, acquire the buildings and perform special actions. Victory points are earned through the acquisition of buildings, elimination of enemy units.

Name: 九州三国志 (Kyushu Sangokushi)
Description:
Kyushu sangokushi (The three realms of Kyushu) covers the battles of the three major clans of the Kyushu island, during the Senkoku period.

Three scenarios are included in this game. "Battle of Mimigawa" and "Battle of Okitanawate" are short scenarios for two players. "Kyushu Sangokushi" (Battle of the three clans in Kyushu) is the campaign scenario for three players.

Each players control one or more clans. The clan's combat units are organized into troops. 
The game repeats the game turn decided by the scenario. There are four action stages in each game turn. The number of stages where each troop can act is decided by commander's activation ability. In the action stage, each troop selects one action. The actions that can be selected are movement, field combat, siege, moral recovery, reorganization and replacement.

The victor is the player who receives the most victory points. The victory point are awarded by the control of a castle and the destruction of enemy units.

SCALE: 
each hex of map is roughly 6000 meters. Each game turn represents one week of real time; each combat units about 1000 soldiers.


Game Journal edition: contains additional scenarios and counters for Hideyoshi Gunki.


This is a game of the "Sengoku Gunyuden" series.

Name: Ta Matete
Description:
From the rules of play:

A simple, fast paced and fun card game

In an imaginary journey through the territories of our souls, deep into the heart of our innery selves we can picture a tree.
The choice of the shape of the tree is not a casual one. Its web of branches, leaves, flowers and fruit is representive of the complexity of human feelings.
Thanks to its symbolic representation of the tree and the display of the 16 feelings through as many works of art, the TA MATETE board game allows players to see their own image reflected in these "figures", thus authentically and deeply entering their own emotional dimension.

The object of the game is to collect the works or art portrayed on the cards of the different feelings. In order to acquire a feeling each player needs to collect three works of art of the same kind connected with that feeling.

CONTENTS:
- A bag containing 48 coloured tiles, 12 for each colour (red, yellow, green, light blue)
- A board portraying the tree of feelings
- Living Gallery: board where to place discards
- 148 cards representing the 16 works of art connected with the 16 feelings
- A paper block to keep score

The TA MATETE board game is an EXCLUSIVE 1000-copy LIMITED EDITION

Name: Salt 'n' Pepper
Description:
The goal is to be the first player to return all of his pieces home by moving them across and off the 10x10 board.

Players choose either Salt white or Pepper black and, using 15 pieces each, take turns moving one piece at a time toward themselves on their respective color squares.

Salt pieces move one square diagonally to a vacant square, or leap diagonally over one opposing piece if the square immediately beyond is vacant.
Pepper pieces move one square orthogonally to a vacant square, or leap diagonally over one opposing piece if the square immediately beyond is vacant.
Pieces may not move backward and are not captured.

The game is over when only one player remains on the board.

Players should alternate using Salt or Pepper pieces every other game.

Name: Monopoly: Isle of Arran Edition
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The game has been redesigned with an Arran twist, featuring Arran villages and local businesses.

Name: Ice Cap
Description:
Nature took millions of years to achieve the conditions for life on earth. Now the oceans are warming, and the Poles have fractured into Icebergs of four different colors melting into the sea.

The Colors of Cold, which are responsible for maintaining the climate of the Icecaps, have become separated. They have drifted north and south and mixed together in the center of the ocean: the play area for our game.

Realizing their plight, the Polar Bears and Penguins have taken responsibility for restoring the climate of their environment. They know that the pattern of the Colors of Cold, which nature took so long to create, can be reset with their help. They must help the colors return to their Polar patterns before the ice melts.

What you do.
Play the Polar Bears or Penguins responsible for returning the melting icebergs to their poles.  The polar animals work alone or in pairs. Too many false moves and the bergs will be gone forever.

Take-away-thought “Nature can heal with our help”.
Nature is quite capable of restoring the right conditions for life, it just needs a little help from the life forms it supports sometimes...

(From the publisher website: www.gamewhys.com)

Name: Toy Story Big Stunt Buzz
Description:
From the box: "Buzz wants to fly...but a tangle of toys stands in his way! Make it through his outrageous, out-of-control stunt, and you might earn enough badges to win!"

User comment: Shades of Mouse Trap and other Rube Goldberg type games! You and the kids build this thing with ramps, tracks, connectors, swivel assembly, towers, soldiers and a catapult...among other stuff...and here's what happens when everything has been put together and someone has moved along the board to land on a Buzz Lightyear space:

(From the instructions) "Buzz, on the Red Baron car completes the loop and spins Rex around; Rex knocks the yellow/purple Hot Wheels car down the ramp; The Hot Wheels car rolls across the board and hits the bottom of the Toy Soldier Stack; The top of the Toy Soldier Stack tips forward, knocking off the Parachute Soldier; The Parachute Soldier lands on the Uno teeter-totter, flipping up Woody's Horse; some or all of the Buzz Badges could fly out of Woody's saddlebags. If it was your Big Stunt, you get to keep the badges that fly out!"

The winner is the one who gets eight badges first, either from Woody's saddlebags or from landing on Buzz Badge spaces.

Name: Chronopia: Firstborn Watchtower
Description:
From the back of the box:

The Firstborn Watchtower is a 3D expansion set, that takes the concept of fighting in and around buildings to a new level, offering a wealth of new opportunities for future battles in Chronopia. it begins with the Firstborn Watchtower but where will it end - in the Ringholds of the Dwarves or in the Tombs beneath a Stygian Ziggurat? This product will allow you to take your battles to new heights and hidden depths.

Contents:
• A full color card model of a Firstborn watchtower: on eight sheets of card for you to construct.
• Two exclusive new miniatures; only available with this boxed set: The 'Enlightened' of the Firstborn and the 'Stalker' from the ranks of the Devout.
• A 32 page booklet containing comprehensive new rules for using buildings on the battlefield and fighting indoors or underground.  A scenario designed around the Firstborn watchtower with descriptive text and battle photographs to put the tower and the new rules in context.
• New templates and counters to help you fight in and around buildings.

Note: This is not a stand-alone product; a copy of the main Chronopia rules is required to use the additional rules included in this box set.

Name: Chronopia: Dwarf Talon Gate
Description:
A 3d Expansion Set for Chronopia

From the back of the box:

The greatest achievement of the Dwarves is also their best-kept secret. Beneath the world of day and night lies a dark world of twisting pathways and unknown terrors - the labyrinth of the Dwarves. Guarding the entrances to this underworld are the mighty Talon Gates. Fortified gateways raised by Dwarven skill in the likeness of the clan's totem, they are built to withstand the most determined onslaught and charged with their defense are the Talon Lords. Dwarves of iron will, sworn to die before any should pass beyond the gates they guard.

This box-set contains:
•An impressive full-color model, for you to construct from 16 A4 sheets of card.
• Two exclusive new Chronopia miniatures - The Dwarven Gatekeeper known as the Talon Lord and the powerful Stygian Hammerhead.
• A 32-page booklet with comprehensive new rules for fighting in and around buildings and structures, and for fighting underground. Also includes new templates and counters.
• A scenario set around a Talon Gate in the Land of the Two Rivers with exciting background text to bring the whole thing to life.

Note: This is not a stand-alone product; a copy of the main Chronopia rules and the Land of Two Rivers supplement are required to use this box set.

Name: High and Low
Description:
A betting game made to emulate an 1800's style bar betting game where there would be no "bank"

The starting player rolls two dice.  They're placed to the side and their total is noted.  In clockwise order, players place bets as to whether their roll will be higher or lower than the first roll.  Maximum bet is the number of players in the current round.  Minimum bet is 1.  Then in clockwise order the players roll the die again.  If their total is higher than the original noted roll they take the "High" bets.  If their total is lower than the original noted role they take the "Low" bets.  On a roll that matches the original noted roll they take both piles.

When players tie for high and low they must split evenly leaving the remainder in the betting pools.  If a player or players roll a match then no "High" or "Low" players win and all bets are divided equally among winners leaving remainders in their original betting pools.

Name: KABOOM!
Description:
The old man stepped into the arena, inhaled one last time on his cigar and flicked it onto the ground, grinding it into the dust with his heel. He looked up, squinting as the setting sun glinted in his eyes. Seven other figures stood in a wide circle, each armed with an array of weaponry - a sniper, a famous action hero, a modern day samurai, a no-nonsense paid assassin, a post-apocalyptic survivor, a huge musclebound powerhouse, an anti-terrorist soldier.....All armed to the teeth and ready to fight to the death.

The retired spec-ops Colonel flicked the latch of the sturdy missile launcher that was slung across his shoulders, checked the magazine of the machine gun hanging across his chest, andd fiddled one last time with the sights of the sniper rifle in his hands.

Overkill was underrated.

KABOOM! is a party game for all ages for 4-8 players. Each player receives one of 8 characters and, using dice, chooses weapons with which to attack their opponents, wearing away their life points until they are the last one left standing. Each round of KABOOM! can be played in a matter of minutes, especially if played at a high tempo, and so although players are eliminated, they never have to wait long for a new round to start! Players are encouraged to hold grudges, get into character, mock, cajole, beg and target the player who keeps winning!

While the game is about shooting eachother, it's abstract enough that it's suitable for children, in fact much of the playtesting was carried out on children aged between 7 and 14....But is also fun and suitable for adults, especially adults who are letting their hair down!

Name: 1825 Development Kit D1: Additional Tiles
Description:
From the packaging:
This 18xx kit augments an existing game. It supersedes previous Kits K1 and K6 and contains more tiles, 36 instead of the 15 in K1 and 12 in K6.

Contents:
Yellow Tiles: 2 each of nos. 7, 58 & 115.
Green Tiles:  3 each of nos. 10 & 11.
              1 each of nos. 17,18,20,21,22,30,31,82 & 83.
Russet Tiles: 2 each of no. 174.
              1 each of nos. 35,36,37,38,39,40,43,44 & 47.
Russet/Green Tiles: 2 of no. 119.
Russet/Brown Tiles: 2 of no. 200.

Name: Caravan
Description:
Caravan is a card game invented in conjunction with the video game "Fallout: New Vegas" (released in October 2010).

The game is set in the post-apocalyptic world of the video game series, and players take the role of caravan owners delivering goods across the wasteland.

Caravan can be played by 2 players using 2 standard decks of playing cards, or the special deck included with the video game.

Caravan plays a bit like a head-to-head version of Blackjack, with the objective being to build three sets of cards - or "caravans" - with the highest possible value. 
You must is outbid your opponent's caravans, without being too light (under 21) or overburdened (over 26).

Certain cards - like Jacks, Queens or Kings - change the rules for building caravans, like the numerical order in which you are allowed to play cards onto your caravans.

Caravan plays in about 10-20 minutes.

Name: Risk 2210 A.D.: Religious Commander
Description:
From the publisher's site:
"The Religious Commander is very powerful and is best used against the Diplomat and Tech Commanders." He brings a lot of new powerful command cards and the known better defense of Commanders like Diplomat and Tech Commander.

The cards of the deck are accessible from the publisher's site for print-and-play.

Name: Vild med dyr
Description:
Vild med dyr ('Crazy about animals') is a Danish trivia gamed about animals for 2-4 player or teams. The payers/teams start at home in each their corner of the game board and have to correctly answer a question (of a self-selected category) in order to get out of the home and onto the game path. On turn each player (out of home) throws a die to move their animal-shaped marker around the board and has to answer questions in one of the five categories depending on the color of the board tile landed upon. A players may change direction on the board after each turn.

The four main categories are:
Lilac: Soft and close (domestic animals) - in Danish: 'Blød & Nær (husdyr og landburgsdyr)' 
Blue: Beaks and fins (birds, fishes, and sea mammals) - in Danish: 'Næb & Finner (fugle, fisk og havpattedyr)'
Light brown: Vild and warm (wild life mammals) - in Danish: 'Vild & Varm (vildtlevende pattedyr)'
Green: Creeping and crawling (insects, frogs, amphibians and reptiles) - in Danish: 'Kryb & Kravl (insekter, føer, padder og krybdyr)'

The fifth additional joker category is:
White: Fun and crazy (problems and challenges) - in Danish: 'Fis & Ballade (opgaver og udfordringer)'

The players collect paws (plastic chips with a paw imprint) in the four main colors by correctly answering questions of the respective colors. The white category cover a variety of challenges to be fulfilled in a certain time (such as naming a certain number of animals starting with a particular letter, or drawing or acting a particular animal) or simply an order to transfer a certain number of paws to or from another player or the stock.

If a player land on a tile occupied by another player, the other players is returned to home and have to start out again (keeping the paws collected so far).

The winner is the player or team who first collect three paws of each color and get back home.

Content:
Game board
Rules
4 animal-shaped game pieces
48 paws - 12 in each main color
1 die
2 boxes with a total of 300 cards with 1500 questions and challenges
4 pads of drawing paper
4 pencils
1 30-seconds hourglass

Name: Hansa Teutonica: East Expansion
Description:
This is the first expansion for Hansa Teutonica. This expansion includes nine mission cards for the basic map. Each mission card shows three cities and the player can receive additional victory points for Kontors in these cities.

In addition the expansion includes a new map: The East-Expansion
This map introduces new items into the game: e.g. Ocean trade routes and permanent bonus markers.

Errata: The rules erroneously mentions the 'Kontor Network', points being given when building the East/West-connection between 'Leipzig' and 'Danzig'. There is no 'Leipzig' on the map. Instead the rules should have stated the city of 'Lübeck'.

Name: Noddy's First Board Game
Description:
From the back of the box:

It's Noddy's birthday and he's having a party! He's going to town to buy all the things he needs. He must hurry, though. Sly & Gobbo, those Toyland troublemakers, will try to buy the party goods first, and ruin Noddy's plans.

Young players move the game figures around the board, collecting objects to fill shopping lists. The colorful chance cards require no reading or number skills, and the simple rules allow for a perfect first board game experience!

Duration of play: about 10 minutes per game.

User Summary:

The first player to collect all the objects on their shopping list and return Noddy to his birthday party wins the game. It's a race against time, however, because if Sly & Gobbo finish their shopping list first, they ruin the party for everyone!

Name: Divinity
Description:
The New Catholic Catechism Learning System.

(from the back of the box)

Designed for Roman Catholics.
The Catholic Catechism Learning System was created by religious educators as a teaching tool for the home, the parish and the classroom...and it's here for you NOW. Your family (youth over ten years old and adults) will forever enjoy learning and sharing their Catholic faith.

The questions and answers contained in this game were composed by a Catholic theologian and inspired by the Catechism of the Catholic Church. Ask your religious education director about the unique advantages of this family learning system for reinforcing knowledge of the Catholic faith!

Name: One Ring Chess
Description:
From the introduction:"One Ring Chess is played upon a field of 32 linearly adjacent squares formed into a ring. The game is won by checkmating the opponent King."

This is a linear chess variant, played on a half-sized board. The "Lord of the Rings" theme of the game points up the byzantine nature of this circular chessboard. Rooklike moves are translated directly to the board. Diagonal moves are translated as jumps, moving by staying always on the same color and hopping over squares of the other color. A full set of pieces and 4 pawns each, coupled with the board's two 1-square wide avenues of approach, offer a good range of chess tactics.

Name: Odin's Rune Chess
Description:
From the author's introduction:
"To create the game I used an approach similar to that used by Carl Jung when he philosophized about the I Ching and the concept of synchronicity... To put myself in the right frame of mind for creating the rune game I first concentrated on Odin and Chess.  In Nordic mythology Odin is a wise god who brought the runes to mankind, something akin to Prometheus bringing fire to men.  I then thoroughly shuffled and mixed a set of rune cards and randomly selected six... I was surprised by the results..."

This 10x10 chess variant takes inspiration from its theme and converts some of the standard chesspieces into their Norse equivalents. All the non-royal pieces retain their moves and capturing abilities. The queen becomes a valkyrie, with the additional power of transporting a king to safety by taking its place on the board. Knights become Forest oxen, with great horns that can kill in a neighboring square. Pawns become minor pieces, giving up their promotion ability to do so. And kings must "consult" before doing anything. The king moves and captures like any friendly piece it starts the turn next to. Each player has 2 of each type of piece, including kings, and 10 pawns. The game is won by capturing both enemy kings.

Name: Zig Zag
Description:
Zig Zag is a racing game using shared pieces but with the players having hidden goals.  Each player is given a card that shows the order in which they want the pieces to finish the race.  During the game, players take turns moving the three coloured markers on the game board.  A turn consists of moving any piece on the board.  The space on which this piece lands will dictate the next piece to move, and how.  This continues until the forced movement is impossible, and then the next player takes a turn.

The game ends when two pieces make it to the finish line.  The player holding the results card showing the order of finish wins!

Name: Ariel the little mermaid
Description:
The board depicts a ship with seven hatches. Around it, there is a course of fields, some of which have special symbols. The hatches are covered with tiles. These hide characters from the Disney movie.
The players roll dice and move around the course. The goal is to collect a set of three cards depicting Ariel's friends, then go onto the ship and flip over hatch tiles. When a hatch tile shows one of the friends, another hatch tile can be flipped over. When the witch appears, the player has to start collecting cards again. When the prince appears, the game ends and the active player is the winner.
While circling the ship, special symbol fields enable the players to draw cards, move forward etc.  When a player reaches a field where (an)other player(s) is/are, he/she can steal a card from each of them.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: The Little Mermaid

Name: 7 Wonders: Manneken Pis
Description:
7 Wonders: Manneken Pis – first available as a promotional item at Spiel 2010, then distributed later via the BGG Store and Spielbox – is a wonder that can be used with the 7 Wonders base game in order for players to have more choices of wonders available to them.

Unlike the wonders included with the base game, Manneken Pis produces no resource of its own, instead giving its owner more money at the start of the game. One side of this wonder allows its owner to copy specific levels found on neighboring wonder cards, while the other side consists of a single level that requires one of each resource for a single huge payoff in power, points, and the purse.

Reimplemented by


     7 Wonders: Wonder Pack

Name: My Friends Tigger & Pooh Word Builder Game
Description:
The game consists of a number of interlockable game pieces, each with two or three connection points.  The pieces are double sided, with one side to be used for younger children and the other side to be used with older children.  The side for younger players contains pictures of Disney characters.  The side for older players contains word fragments that can be matched up to form words.

Each player starts with the same number of game pieces, and an additional piece is laid in the center of the play area.  Starting with the youngest player, each player in turn links a piece from their hand to a piece already in play.  If a player is not able play, that player draws a piece from the supply of unused pieces, and may play the new piece if able.  In either case, play then passes to the next player.  The first player to run out of game pieces is the winner.

Name: Reisen til den forheksede øya Gral
Description:
It is a race where the first pirate ship that reaches the island Gral is the winner. On the trip you meet different hazards such as pirate attacks, hurricanes and bad food.

This game is put in the world of Kaptein Sabeltann and came with the children’s magazine "kaptain Sabeltann nr 5 2010"

The game is a typical roll and move game, where you must follow the instructions on the square you land on. This could be miss a turn or taking a short cut in the same manner as snakes and ladders.

Name: Alex & Co
Description:
This game is named after Alex Randolph and jointly published by the Europäische Spielesammlergilde and the Spieleautorenzunft. The game has been announced for Essen 2010.
The cards show famous game designers and the games they designed. The number of game cards for each designer varies; the goal in this memory style game is to collect as many games from a given designer as possible.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Heian Shogi
Description:
From the rules found on pg 15 of [url=http://files.boardgamegeek.com/file/download/4obzn970uj/HistoricalChessVariants.pdf?]this document[/url], a document with citations by Nader Daoud Daou (made free by the author for non-commercial distribution).

The game is a traditional Japanese game of the chess family which can be played with an international chess set. It is of the shogi branch of the chess family but does not involve drops. Set-up is on the back row identical to international chess [i]except[/i] that king is placed on the center left column for either player so that kings are not facing each other. Pawn however occupy the third rather than the second row.

For simplicity, I'm using the international chess names of pieces rather than the traditional Japanese names. The king moves one space in any direction but castling does not exist. The queen moves one space in any direction except diagonally backwards. Bishops move either one space diagonally in any direction or one space forward. Knights move only forward in an otherwise normal knight's move so that the piece jumps to a space on either side of the space two rows ahead of its starting position. Rooks move only forward but otherwise like a standard rook. Pawns move only one space forward with no initial two-step move, and all pieces including pawns capture as they move.

The promotion zone is the last three rows on the board for either player. All pieces except the king and queen promote to the queen. Promotion is optional so long as a piece still has a legal move in its non-promoted state. The promotion happens at the end of the move and the move must either begin or end in the promotion zone.

The object is to check-mate the opponent's king. Both bared king and stalemate count as a win, but a bared king becomes a draw if the other player can bare one's king in the next move.

Name: Sho Shogi
Description:
Source is rules found on pgs 16-17 of this document by Nader Daoud Daou (2007).

Although this is the game from which modern Shogi is believed to have directly derived, the game are distinctly different if the following respects. Sho shogi has no drop mechanism. All pieces used in modern shogi are used in sho shogi and have the same movements and initial positions, but sho shogi also has one additional piece with respect to the modern game-- the drunken elephant which promotes to a crown prince and begins the game directly in front of the "king" (osho or gyokusho). The drunken elephant moves one space in any direction except directly backwards, and the crown prince moves exactly like a king because it is a second king. Namely both the crown prince and the king must be bared, checkmated and/or stalemated simultaneously to win. Baring counting as a draw only if one's own king can be bared the next move.

According to "A World of Chess" by Jean-Louis Cazaux & Rick Knowlton (2017, ISBN 978-0-7864-9427-9), Bishop, Rook and Drunk Elephant were introduced to the 9x9 Shogi creating Sho Shogi, the immediate predecessor of Shogi, in the middle of the 15th century. Modern Shogi where created with the introduction of the drop rule and the removal of the Drunk Elephant piece in Sho Shogi. This happened between 1567 (Drunk Elephant still present) and 1587 (earliest recording of modern Shogi).

Name: Super Teddyx
Description:
User Summary:

Using clues given on each of the game cards, players place nine teddy bear markers of three different colours in their proper spaces.  The clues offer rules for the particular game card.  For example, the clues may state that a blue bear sits after a red bear, or that a green bear cannot sit after a blue bear.  The players, then, must use logic in order to solve the card.

There are eleven different puzzles included in the box.

The game can be played solo, cooperative or competitively.  In the competitive mode, players divide the bears amongst themselves.  On a turn, the player will roll the colour die and may place a bear of that colour on the puzzle.  Making a wrong placement results in a two turn penalty.  The player to correctly place his last bear on the puzzle wins.

Name: Kursk Campaign
Description:
Kursk Campaign, a computer game of Operation Zitadelle, summer 1943.

Kursk Campaign is a command oriented study of the battle, the greatest tank confrontation in history. The Axis player must cut into the bulging Soviet line and destroy any trapped Red forces. The Soviet player must brunt the attack with defense in depth and attrite the Axis into defeat. The game includes 2 sets of playing pieces and simulation maps for both players. The computer will act as a player for either side. Scenarios include both early and late Axis offensive start dates.

Design by Stephen St. John, development by S. Newberg and art by J. Kula. Disk for Apple II or IBM PC systems.

Name: Carson City: A New Beginning
Description:
Got a hankerin' to enter town with a different pack full of money, materials, and cowboys? Then welcome at Carson City - a New Beginning!

This expansion gives you exactly what the title suggests: a new way to begin the fantastic boardgame Carson City. Fine tune your own setup. Choose between more money, roads, cowboys, or revolvers…and be prepared to get some great new special powers, like the Marksman or Influential Connections.

Name: Spel van het jaar 2003
Description:
What happened in the year 2002?

Spel van het jaar 2003 (dutch for 'game of the year') offers a full-view of the year as a quiz game; an educational question/answer game. A game in which de funniest, (most/least) important moments of the year step into the spotlight.

The game has been re-edited and expanded with the alphabetgame.

Contents;
118 alphabet/question cards
1 die

Name: Het grote Parkeerspel
Description:
Each player drives his car on the border of the board. You can start having parkingplaces on the streets of the different cities. Later you can expand there building parkings with several layers.

With more layers you get more revenue when other players park in your parking.When a parking has 3 layers it cannot have a hostile take-over.

You get points by having parkings with 3 layers (1 point each parking), points by having special strategycards (with P1 bonus of 1 point) and by completing your mission card you got at the start of the game (1,2 or 3 points).

The player with 11 (2 players), 7 ( 3 players) or with 5 (4 players) points wins the game.

Name: Yvio: Pettersson und Findus
Description:
Board game which needs an Yvio console to be played. When a chip is inserted, there are seven different game options (and a combination of several of these). The board contains pictures of 20 animals. When a player puts a pawn on one of these, it is registered by the machine.
The console can make the sounds of the 20 animals, and most game ideas use this. The sound of one animal sounds, for example, and the first player to put a piece on the corresponding picture scores, for example. The console also functions as a die, so some roll and moves are also included. The "Olympiade" mode combines the scores of various games to determine an overall winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Signum Mortis
Description:
Signum Mortis is a game for 3 to 6 players lasting between 3 to 5 hours aimed at more mature gamers. The game - even though cynical and satirical - is based in part on the historical facts as outlines by Marcus Tullius Cicero in his famous speech in defense of Sextus Roscius. Even though you can trust Cicero - as lawyer that he was - to illuminate the 'facts' in a specific light, also according to other sources the proscriptions were every bit as bad and corrupt as shown in this game.

Players take the role of Chiefs of Roman gangs from the Aventine Hill during Sulla’s reign of terror and proscription of 82BC. On one hand the players are building a reputation for being most daring, bringing proscribed but highly influential Senators or Equites to 'justice' (by chopping of their heads). By this they gain blood money as bounty while also plundering the homes of those unfortunates. Still, some of that money should better find its way back into Crysogonus’ coffers. The freedman Chrysogonus was Sulla's right-hand man in this and his 'secretarius' meticulously notes down your name and the bounty paid. Chrysogonus does not look favorable on those lacking generosity in their presents. On the other hand, the gangs also raise money by extorting the grain merchants or the red-light district. Player’s might also prey on each other in an attempt to rob the other gangs of their ill-gotten wealth either on the way home or by besieging or storming and plundering their lair. But beware Sulla’s veterans patrolling the streets and your competitors as bounty hunter, Sulla’s freedmen the Sullani. Players use their boss and his three lieutenants, all of them being specialized for different roles, and beef up their gangs by rogues lending numbers, muscles, speed or stealth. Sometimes guile succeeds where brutal force fails. The hulking brute - worth 3 normal men in a fight - might be hard-pressed to blend into the crowd if a patrol of Veterans enters the city quarter. Players might try to bribe officials to influence the Civil War, steer the patrols or 'ameliorate'their records with the 'secretarius' while influencing the proscription lists. They use prophecies by the witch (the 'Stryga') to influence and scare their superstitious opponents. The overall goal is to become the richest and most infamous of all bosses. Still, finally peace will come. Depending on the outcome of the civil war which the players might vigorously try to influence, the Chief having killed the wrong people and the Chief not having parted generously enough with his money, "unfortunately" will be executed.

This will leave only those of the rich and infamous who survived, to finally win the game.

Name: Hoke's Run: July 3rd 1861
Description:
1861 - Hoke’s Run (American Civil War in 3D)

This absolutely FREE complementary battle in our series of the American Civil Wargames in 3D sees the Union army under General M.G Robert Patterson attempting to defeat the Confederate army of General Joseph E. Johnston at Hoke’s Run in the Shenandoah Valley.

This fictional encounter is a prelude to First Manassas.  The battle at Hoke’s Run could have very easily taken place, because General Patterson drove the Confederates away South from Falling Waters the previous day.  The Confederates regrouped around Hoke’s Run and camped ready for battle the following day, but Patterson failed to press the Confederates and moved to Martinsburg instead.  The Confederates waited four days for a battle that never came.

The game can be played in about 1 hour; it is very tactical and can be played again and again.  It has a time limit of 16 bounds in which the Confederates must inflict a devastating defeat on the Union army.  Its design allows for a fast, fun and realistic game that gives a flavour of the American Civil War period.  A simple chain of command solution adds intrigue to the game, keep the chain of command together and everything is fine, lose it and it could cost you the game?

Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters, these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit.  You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensionally as a straight print and play or 3 dimensionally, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion.  The final 3D game board gives you a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.

Included with the download is the 3D Game Board in two quadrants, the Hoke’s Run five page Battle Report, the Gaming Counters, a simple guide on how to build a 3D Game Board, the Brothers At Arms twenty page Rules Booklet with Playsheet, a twenty four hour Timeline Table and finally a set of Tile Dice.  The game rules are fast and easy to learn and will be the same throughout the full series of American Civil War in 3D.

Can you start this great series of battles with a victory?  Play North or South in this the introductory game of the American Civil War in 3D series of board games.

>Source: WargamesDownload.com
Families: Series: American Civil War in 3D (Wargame Shop)

Name: First Manassas: July 21st 1861
Description:
1861 - First Manassas (American Civil War in 3D)

The first battle in our series of the American Civil War games in 3D sees the Union army under General McDowell meet the combined armies of the Confederation under General Beauregard and General Johnston.  The battle is fought just north of Manassas Junction across the stream called the Bull Run.  The Union hope for a swift victory to end the war, but a delayed attack by the Union has allowed the Confederates to combine its two armies.  The Union still outnumber the Confederates, but only just, so let the drums roll and the flags fly, it’s time for brother to meet brother.

The game can be easily played over 2-3 hours and there is a 16 bound time limit on it.  Its design allows for a fast, fun and realistic game that gives a flavour of the American Civil War period.  A simple chain of command solution adds intrigue to the game, keep the chain of command together and everything is fine, lose it and it could cost you the game?
Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters, these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit.  You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensionally as a straight print and play or 3 dimensionally, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion.  The final 3D game board gives you a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.

Included with the download is the 3D Game Board in four quadrants, the First Manassas six page Battle Report, the Gaming Counters, a simple guide on how to build a 3D Game Board, the Brothers At Arms twenty page Rules Booklet with Playsheet, a twenty four hour Timeline Table and finally a set of Tile Dice.  The game rules are fast and easy to learn and will be the same throughout the full series of American Civil War in 3D.

Can you start this great series of battles with a victory?  Play North or South in this the first of the American Civil War in 3D series of board games.

>Source: wargamesdownload.com
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: American Civil War in 3D (Wargame Shop)

Name: Wilson's Creek: August 10th 1861
Description:
1861 - Wilson’s Creek (American Civil War in 3D)

The second battle in our series of the American Civil War games in 3D sees the Union army under General Nathanial Lyon make a daring dawn raid on the Confederate forces.  The Union are outnumbered more than two to one, but Lyon is banking on his more skilled men being able to win the day.  Can the Confederates commanded by General Benjamin McCulloch stop this bold Union action?

The game is quick to play in less than 1 hour, but it is very tactical and can be played again and again.  It has a time limit of 18 bounds in which the Union must achieve their objective.  Its design allows for a fast, fun and realistic game that gives a flavour of the American Civil War period.  A simple chain of command solution adds intrigue to the game, keep the chain of command together and everything is fine, lose it and it could cost you the game?

Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters, these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit.  You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensionally as a straight print and play or 3 dimensionally, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion.  The final 3D game board gives you a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.

Included with the download is the 3D Game Board in two quadrants, the Wilson’s Creek five page Battle Report, the Gaming Counters, a simple guide on how to build a 3D Game Board, the Brothers At Arms twenty page Rules Booklet with Playsheet, a twenty four hour Timeline Table and finally a set of Tile Dice.  The game rules are fast and easy to learn and will be the same throughout the full series of American Civil War in 3D.

Can you continue this great series of battles with another victory?  Play North or South in this the second of the American Civil War in 3D series of board games.

>Source: wargamesdownload.com
Families: Series: American Civil War in 3D (Wargame Shop)

Name: Fort Donelson: February 15th 1862
Description:
1862 - Fort Donelson (American Civil War in 3D)

The third battle in our series of the American Civil Wargames in 3D sees the Union army under General U.S. Grant laying siege to the Confederate held Fort Donelson.  Grant has just come directly with his army from his victory at Fort Henry only a few days prior.

The Confederate General John B. Floyd has held a council of war and it was proposed that the Confederate army should attempt to breakout and head for Nashville.  So on the morning of the 15th February 1862 the Confederates prepare for their assault, luck is on their side as General Grant is away from the immediate location of Fort Donelson.

Fort Donelson has a time limit of 12 bounds in which the Confederates must achieve their objective.  Its design allows for a fast, fun and realistic game within a 2 hour period of continuous play.  The game gives a flavour of the American Civil War period and a simple chain of command solution adds intrigue to the game, keep the chain of command together and everything is fine, lose it and it could cost you the game?

Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters, these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit.  You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensionally as a straight print and play or 3 dimensionally, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion.  The final 3D game board gives you a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.

Included with the download is the 3D Game Board in four quadrants, the Fort Donelson six page Battle Report, the Gaming Counters, a simple guide on how to build a 3D Game Board, the Brothers At Arms twenty page Rules Booklet with Playsheet, a twenty four hour Timeline Table and finally a set of Tile Dice.  The game rules are fast and easy to learn and will be the same throughout the full series of American Civil War in 3D.

Can you continue this great series of battles with another victory?  Play North or South in this the third of the American Civil War in 3D series of board games.

>Source: wargamesdownload.com
Families: Series: American Civil War in 3D (Wargame Shop)

Name: Monster Mix Up
Description:
From the back of the box:
The Monsters are all mixed up! Can ask the right questions and guess the monster on your opponents card before they guess yours?

User Summary:
A knock-off of Guess Who? that requires players to guess their opponent's secret monster card. Adds some giggly fun to the tried-and-true guessing game when players are forced ask questions such as, "Does your monster have 3 eyes?" or "Does your monster have green skin?"

Comes with:
2 Playing Boards (1 Purple, 1 Green)
3 Sheets of Pre-cut Monster Cards
2 Sets of Plastic Frames and Scoring Markers
1 Instruction Sheet

Name: Tausend Zahlwörter
Description:
The game consists of 50 number cards and 60 numeral cards. There are various ways to play with these, aimed at children with dyscalculia issues, but grown-ups can also play this. 
The main rule set requires players to just use the numeral cards. The game starts with one card on the table. Now the players take turns either adding a card from their hand or replacing a card with one or more card(s) from their hand. The only condition is that the numeral on the table has to get bigger each time. A player who cannot increase the number on the table loses a point and the cards are dealt again. The maximum number that can be achieved with the included cards is nine hundred ninety nine thousand eight hundred and ninety eight (which is one word in German).

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Go Fart
Description:
This game consists of a whoopie cushion and a poker card deck with various names of farts on them.

The farts are graded by the Fart Meter as follows:
2 - Whoopie Cushion
3 - Hand over Mouth
4 - Hand Under Armpit
5 - Hand Under Knee
6 - Loud But Harmless
7 - Foghorn
8 - Tea Kettle
9 - Loud and Odorous
10 - Spotters
J - Forever Fart
Q - S.B.D.
K - The Flamer
A - Atomic Bomb

The game is a Go Fish variant where the person who makes an unsuccessful request for a card, can either draw for the card they need, or they can attempt a fart that matches the card they desire.  So if the player asks for a 4 and they are told to "Go Fart", they can draw from the deck or they can do a "Hand Under Armpit" fart, which is what the Fart Meter shows for a 4.  Other players judge the fart.

From the back of the box....
If you plan ahead you can really have "a gas" with this game.  The have a "leg up" on your opponents be sure to consume large quantities of beans or chili with carbonated beverages.

Object: The object of the game is to be the first person to get rid of all your cards by creating three of a kind or a run of three consecutive numbers i.e. three Spotters (three 10's) or a run of J,Q,K (Forever Fart, S.B.D., The Flamer).

Name: Pentology Card Game
Description:
From the website. "www.pentologygames.com"

Pentology is an adventure card game. While the core mechanics remain constant, the cards are designed for use in any number of different games. It is most comparable to a standard fifty-two card deck of playing cards. Although it does not have suits and numbers, jacks or queens, Pentology does allow mathematically sound strategy; group, team or solo play; simplicity or complexity; all with the same deck of cards.

Pentology further provides players with a backdrop fantasy theme for every game. With Pentology cards, solitaire games become a mission of saving your allies and defeating your nemesis; poker style games suggest the fun of defining the characteristics of your own hero, and then pitting her strengths against your opponent's; and blackjack feels like a quick skirmish.

Standard playing cards have long been popular because of the vast number of games that can be played with a single deck. Pentology cards boast that same value. Each deck includes a rulebook with rules for five different games, and as creative enthusiasts come up with new game rules and post them on the forum, the list of available games will grow.

With the support of online community, players can continually find new games, contribute their own ideas, and vote on which games to standardize.

Name: Critical Hit! Issue 1
Description:
First biannual issue of "The Independent Journal of the ASL Hobby"

From the table of contents:
Wet Behind the Ears by Russ Bunton
St. Joost in My Mind by Joe Leoce
Enter the Kreigsmarine by Leon Harris
ASL Variations by John Gardner
Scenario Replay by Rob Banozic and Scott Drane
Back to Balta by Ray Tapio and Steven Pleva
Sicily From a Loser's Point of View by Andrea Matteuzzi
ASL Editorial Page by Rob Wolkey and Dave Longworth

Scenarios:
CH1 Authie: The Death of Company C
CH2 The Capture of Balta: August 1941
CH3 The Green Hell
CH4 Steutzpunkt Vierville
CH5 Acts of Defiance
CH6 Armored Probe
CH7 Prelude to Breakthrough
CH8 The Predators
CH9 Breakthrough to Kozani
CH10 Forest Strongpoint

Name: Critical Hit! Issue 2
Description:
Second biannual issue of "The Independent Journal of the ASL Hobby"

From the table of contents:
The Siberians: Masters of the Russian Winter by Steven Swann
Moyland, Bloody Moyland by Ray Tapio and Steven Pleva
ASL 201 by Russ Bunten
Where Did They Come From? by Robinson and Ruta
Dying by the Half Squad by Robinson and Ruta
Raging Furnace by Michael J. Klautky
Attack on Narrow Pass by Major John F. Schmitt, USMC
Into the Valley by Kramer, Haseler and Bishop

Scenarios:
CH11 Rite of Passage
CH12 Snow Ghosts
CH13 Moyland, Bloody Moyland
CH14 Ninety Minute War
CH15 No Farther
CH16 Out of Luck
CH17 Funnies at Zyfflich
CH18 Raging Furnace
CH19 Into the Valley
CH20 The Hand of Fate
CH21 A Ridge too Far
CH22 Schwerpunkt
CH23 Suffer the Children...
CH24 Those Normandy Nights
CH25 Land of the Khan

Name: Global Control
Description:
DESCRIPTION:
Have you ever wanted to rule the world?  Now you can do so -- with Global Control!  This is a card game where 2-4 players compete by using power cards and strategy to outsmart and outplay fellow players.  Your objective is to take control of countries from around the globe.

Do you save your powerful cards to capture a key country?  Do you sabotage your friends?  Do you sit back and watch two competitors duke it out and waste their resources?

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Have the most points once 20 random countries are owned.

GAMEPLAY:
Players take turns bidding on countries, using 'power cards'.  The highest bidder takes control of the country which moves them closer to global domination.

GAME ELEMENTS:
•Players can collect cards and store up additional firepower to control key countries
•Many cards affect the effectiveness of other cards, creating player contention
•Countries provide additional 'special powers' that can be leveraged

Name: Paradise Plunge
Description:
Two groups of friends meet while vacationing on a tropical island.  While relaxing at the local tiki bar, they enter into a friendly wager.  They will take to the skies, and each team of friends will race through the tropical skies, plunging by parachute back to the island.  The last group back to the tiki bar buys a round for everyone.

Paradise Plunge is a game of strategy for two players who must assemble their teams in the air and reach the island and the tiki bar before their opponents.  Players begin with their teams of parachuters spread across the tiles that make up the sky over the island.  Each turn, a player may move one of their parachuters, "play the wind" by rearranging the tiles in a row or column according to direction of the wind as marked on the tiles, or rotate one or two tiles so that the wind on those tiles points in a different direction.  Movement is complicated by the fact one player may push an adjacent player in the direction of the wind, but may not separate groups of three or four of the opponent's parachuters.  The winner is the player to move all four of their parachuters to adjacent tiles with one of those parachuters on or adjacent to the island tile.

Name: Florancala
Description:
An Oware variant for the entire family

Enjoy the feel of the gameboard, designed in the shape of a blossom.

Florancala is somewhat more tactical than the well-known "Little Stones Game" (BAO), but can easily be played with children from about 6 years on.

Semi-precious stones in the petals are collected and distributed; colored wooden balls in the hollows of the inner circle are used to mark the players' own starting spaces.

Each player may take stones only from his own hollows and distribute them.
If the last stone falls into an opposing petal in which then 2 or 3 stones are lying, the player may take these from the board and lay them down on the table, in front of him.
The player who has collected the most stones in the end wins.

Start in your own hollows - capture only from opposing hollows.

• Solid gameboard in blossom shape, 30 x 30 cm
• 48 semi-precious stones and 32 wooden balls in 4 colors

Name: Camino
Description:
In Camino players race to complete at least one full round around the board, and then as far as they can get. There's a special die that has to be rolled which dictates moves. Then there are the caminis. Tokens that can be collected and used for various purposes during the game to get an advantage on your opponents.

Taken from publishers website:
The game for sighted AND visually handicapped players

The pieces are colored and can be effectively sensed by touch. They are put in the hollows on the board in such a way that they won't slip out of place. The large wooden die with extra-deep indentations comes with a board that will be appreciated also by sighted people.

Frank Stark has designed a game that is fun to play with the entire family.

A player who believes he is on his final spurt can still be pushed back by a 'stopper' die roll, or an opponent moves your own piece back again - this causes lots of trouble and mischievous joy, no matter whether the player can see or not.

Knowing the way Frank Stark is, it is quite clear that he wouldn't think of just one game for one board - so Camino comes with an additional bonus game and two more variants to choose from.

... And why shouldn't Camino be played also by people who can see but are blindfolded?

Name: Leningrad Pack
Description:
16 Scenarios compatible with the ASL system.

FE 62 Uncle Joe's Fury, July 1941: An old fashioned combined arms assault on boards 48 and 44 with a good sized Russian infantry and tank force attempting to capture buildings and kill Germans who are equipped with infantry, tanks and guns.

FE 63 Out Land, August 1941: The Finns and the Russians go at it in this scenario. Finnish infantry assaults the board 10 and 42 villages attempting to capture buildings against infantry, guns and tanks.

FE 64 The Iron Ring is Closed, August 1941: This is a very meaty scenario. 44 German squads, OBA, halftracks and assault guns attack on boards 40, 49, 42, 24, 22 and 23. The Russians defend with 42 squads and several guns. The victory conditions are interesting with each side attempting to control the riverbank.

FE 65 Straight to the Front, September 1941: This scenario offers some good replay value. The Germans attack across boards 19 and 11 attempting to capture some buildings. The Germans get SS infantry and some AFV. The Russians start with some infantry and receive random tank support. A medium sized scenario should be popular.

FE 66 Tedium, October 1941: This is a classic slogging match across boards 19 and 44. Dug-In Russian troops try to stop a combined arms German force. The Germans have infantry, tanks and halftracks against the Russians with infantry, fortifications and Guns.

FE 67 A Cold Day in Hell, December 1941: The Finns and the Russians go at it in this small infantry only action. The action takes place in winter conditions on boards 8 and 42. This should make for good tourney action.

FE 68 Beast of Prey, March 1942: A real and true slugfest in the woods. Once again dug-in Russian defenders on boards 32 and 36 try to hold Germans from exiting the board. The Russians get infantry, fortifications and Guns while the Germans get SS infantry and some Stugs.

FE 69 Tiger Woods, August 1942: Yes! Another scenario with Tiger in its title!!! If that is not enough to get you excited then this scenario's OB should do it. The Germans get 4 Tigers up against a couple of Russian T-43's and a AA Truck. Each side gets a good number of infantry. This action takes place on boards 36 and 42.

FE 70 Worker's Settlement No. 8, September 1942: This cool infantry only scenario (well the Germans get one INF gun) takes place on board 33 and 4. This scenario has a cool twist for entry conditions with the Russians entering anywhere on 3 board edges. A cool twist in the VC makes for some uncertainty on where to attack. Sure to be a favorite for the tourney crowd.

FE 71 Cold Steel Rain, January 1943: This is another meaty scenario that should offer some good replay value given the variable VC. The Germans get infantry and some AT Guns and defend on boards 33 and 48 against attacking Russian infantry, OBA and some T-60 tanks. .

FE 72 Manos a la Manos, February 1943: The Spanish Blue Division makes its debut in this action on boards 13 and 18. The Spanish infantry with an AT Gun and some variable additional forces must defend some terrain against a lot of Russian infantry, tanks and Flamethrower tanks. The Russians got the numbers but do they have the time to capture the victory terrain?!

FE 73 Polar Star, February 1943: Another meaty old-fashioned scenario, this time on boards 17, 19 and 18. The Germans get 24 squads, fortifications, Stugs and some AT Guns and must hold off a swarm of 32 Russian squads, Assault guns and tanks from exiting and capturing some buildings. Lots of options in this one fore each side.

FE 74 Fruitless Fighting, March 1943: The classic capture the village type scenario on boards 12 and 17. This scenario features 20 Russian squads supported by tanks and assault guns attacking the village against an outpost of SS infantry and some fortifications. The Germans receive reinforcements in the form of infantry and 4 Tiger tanks.

FE 75 Porech'e Push, August 1943: My favorite of the scenarios in this pack. The Russians fight out of a bridgehead against a strong German force to capture the hills overlooking their bridgehead. Really get the flavor of the historic action in this one. The Russians get a bunch of infantry and an assortment of AFV against German infantry, guns and additional forces that they select from an available force pool. This scenario is set on boards 3, 8 and 49.

FE 76 The Battle of Krasnogvadeisk, January 1944: This is another one of those big scenarios that capture the flavor of east front action. Set on boards 18, 49 and 22 this is a meaty scenario with 26 Russian squads and 5 AFV attacking to capture some buildings against 21 squads, 4 tanks and some fortifications.

FE 77 Stalin's Revenge, June 1944: Another Finnish versus Russian scenario setup on boards 5 and 32. This is a smallish scenario featuring 9 Finnish squads and a couple of AT Guns against 15 Russian squads and 3 AFV. This is a brutal one for the Finnish as they attempt to stop the Russians from capturing some buildings.

Name: Kareda
Description:
The goal of the game is that the player has to get rid of three of their own color towers. At the beginning of the game, each player receives seven tiles of each color. From the rest of the stones a playing field is built up of 10x10 pieces.
The starting player rolls with the six dice. Once the die is cast, a player turns the hour glass. As long as the hourglass is running, all players have time to explore on the field a similar set of stones which are set by the dice. The goal is to identify as quickly as possible to the corresponding color as in the color field. The more stones the found color range contains, the more point a player gets.

Name: Agricola: The Legen*dairy Forest-Deck
Description:
Released as part of Lookout Games' 10th anniversary celebration, Agricola: The Legen*dairy Forest Deck (German: Agricola: Tannenbäumchendeck) is a 24-card expansion deck that acts as a sequel to the earlier Agricola: X-Deck, released at Spiel 2008. The game takes a lighthearted look at fairy tales, movies, and books that involve the forest and applies those story ideas to the Agricola universe. The expansion is expected to be released widely in German and English and was first released at Spiel 2010.

This expansion has 24 cards that will add a new dimension to your games of Agricola, and it is incorporated into the game in a similar fashion to the X-Deck. Shuffle the cards together at the start of the game to form the Forest Deck; whenever any player claims three or more wood in a single action—whether by taking the 3 Wood/4 Wood action space or by taking wood that's accumulated on other spaces—you draw a card from the deck and use it. Many of the cards in the expansion will have an immediate effect on the game, though there are some Minor Improvements, Occupations, and new Action Spaces that may be drawn as well. There may even be other surprises lurking amongst the cards—after all, nobody expects the Spanish Inquisition (nor Gisemück the dragon)!

From the box:  "When farmers are done with their daily tasks and gather around the warmth of their hearth, stories are told of revenants and werewolves, unicorns, witches, faeries, and other creatures of the wood. And those who have to go into the forest the next day to fell some trees might remember some of the old stories... and shudder."

Name: Käse Kaos
Description:
In this skill game the children try to fish just the pieces of cheese with a spoon from the cheese box.  As a reward, and as a salvation from the mousetrap, you get a prize mouse - and with six mice in your color you have one victory in his pocket.
But beware: If a cat is revealed the mice are rescued quickly.

On his turn a player rolls a dice. All players look at the picture on the dice. Then the first player calls "Say Cheese". Now all players grab their spoon and try to catch the cheese parts on the picture. The first player who collects all parts of the picture gets a mouse. When a player collects 3 mice, he is the winner.

Contents: 24 card mice, 36 pieces of cheese, 3 dice, 4 plates, 4 spoons;

Name: The Body Snatchers
Description:
"Look, you fools, you're in danger! Can't you see? They're after you! They're after all of us! Our wives, our children, everyone! THEY'RE HERE, ALREADY! YOU'RE NEXT!"

The quiet and desolate town of Santa Mira is being invaded by alien spores that have drifted through space propelled by the force of light.
People have started to accuse their loved ones of being impostors but are however dismissed for being part of some mass hysteria. But you know better, you've seen the signs.  You know that these people are being replaced with duplicates of themselves, grown from plantlike pods while sleeping.

Now it's up to you if these Pod People are not to replace the entire human race before they move on to the next world. If only you knew for certain whom and whom not to...

Based upon the science fiction novel by Jack Finney. In The Body Snatchers the players are secretly taking on the roles as both Pod People and Humans to either fight to absorb the world or to save it from being utterly vanquished.

In turns the players will choose one of the characters on the board to move around the city of Santa Mira and perform a number of available actions that are accessible at the different locations. The Pod People seek to infiltrate the city and must do so by secretly assigning Influence cards from their hand to the different locations.

The Humans play in the same fashion but as they will be outnumbered and seek to sabotage the invasion, they must try to assigning as low Influence as they possibly can without raising too much suspicion on their part. If they're not detected and manage to hinder the aliens from influencing more than half of the city within one week they have succeeded. But if the city has been overrun by then the world shall never wake up again.

"The seed is planted... now terror grows."

Name: My Little Vineyard
Description:
A  print-and-play dice (and resource management) game of making wine. All that is required is a lot of 6-sided dice, and a score sheet for each player.

Players roll a bunch of dice to create a central communal pool, and then take turns pulling out groups of dice from the center pool of dice to buy supplies. Eventually, a player will have enough supplies to make a barrel of wine and score points.

However, the trick is that since the center pool of dice is constantly dwindling, a player has to plan accordingly, since on future turns the dice pool may not have the correct kinds of dice that a player needs to get the desired supply he wants.

A new addition in the market board, which makes the timing of selling your wine all the more important.


The game is up to version 7 or something, but the game is now strong enough that I refuse to call it a beta anymore. I have placed all of the files into a single zip file, as linked below:

http://www.boardgamegeek.com/filepage/66776/my-little-vineyard-all-game-files

Name: Critical Hit! Issue 3
Description:
Third biannual issue of "The Independent Journal of the ASL Hobby"

From the table of contents:
Toasting Marshmallows by Charles Markuss and Shaun Carter
Holding the Line by Robert Modarelli
Scenario Design by Steven C. Swann
Yad Mordechai by Steve Parillo

Scenarios:
CH26 Close Order Driel
CH27 Fix Bayonets!
CH28 Children of the Kunai
CH29 Gift Wrapped
CH30 Kravchenko's 6th Guards Tank Army
CH31 First and Goal
CH32 The Kibbutz
CH33 At the Point
CH34 The Lighthouse
CH35 Obong-Ni
CH36 Saving the Breakout
CH37 Forgotten Years
CH38 Orange Beach 3
CH39 Bedja Blockade
CH40 Nordic Twilight

Name: Chaos Isle: Rise of the Creator
Description:
From the Publisher:

The Virus, ever changing, has spread like a plague, holding the Isle hostage within its deathly grip. Zombis are mutating and hordes of the undead are being driven by powerful new masters. Heroes fight valiantly to save the Isle, but the virus-fueled undead seem impossible to overcome. The Virus has infected the Heroes as well, empowering them to perform amazing feats. Rather than using their newfound abilities to save the Isle, however, they have begun to work against each other in a desperate struggle for self preservation. The Creator will soon reign triumphant as the Isle swiftly falls into the hands of the Dead...

Rise of The Creator is a 30 card Player Interactive Enhancement for Chaos Isle: Zombi Deck. Now players can use the new Feat Deck to perform amazing actions to bolster their own Characters or to wreak havoc with the other players. Each hand plays different using the new Virus Deck. Attack each other with the 'Homicidal Characters' Virus or succumb to the Virus with 'The Virus Unleashed'. With 200 possibilities no hand will feel the same! Mutation cards inhabit the Enemy Deck, making Zombis more powerful than ever and Tasks more treacherous. Also infesting the Enemy Deck are 2 new Boss Zombis.

Name: Witch Hunt
Description:
